00009     construct from LCObject

00011   SatCorrItepCutOff::SatCorrItepCutOff( EVENT::LCObject* obj ) : _scaling( 1.0 )
00012   {
00013     EVENT::LCGenericObject* gObj = dynamic_cast< EVENT::LCGenericObject* >( obj );
00014 
00015     if ( gObj == NULL )
00016       throw std::invalid_argument( "SatCorrItepCutOff: this LCObject is not LCGenericObject" );
00017 
00018     if ( gObj->getNInt() != 1 || gObj->getNFloat()%2 != 0 )
00019       throw std::invalid_argument( "SatCorrItepCutOff: suspicious number of elements in this LCGenericObject" );
00020 
00021     setIntVal( 0, gObj->getIntVal( 0 ) );
00022 
00023     for ( int i = 0; i != gObj->getNFloat(); ++i )
00024       setFloatVal( i, gObj->getFloatVal( i ) );
00025   }

00029     construct from HcalTileIndex
00030   ************************************************/
00031   SatCorrItepCutOff::SatCorrItepCutOff( const HcalTileIndex& hti,
00032                                         const unsigned int nPoints,
00033                                         const float* pixs,
00034                                         const float* pmts ) : _scaling( 1.0 )
00035   {
00036     setIndex( hti );
00037 
00038     for ( unsigned int i = 0; i != nPoints; ++i )
00039       {
00040         setPix( i, pixs[i] );
00041         setPmt( i, pmts[i] );
00042       }
00043 
00044   }

00052   /************************************************
00053    deSaturate
00054   ************************************************/
00055   float SatCorrItepCutOff::deSaturate( const float saturatedSignal ) const
00056   {
00057     /*  protect against negative/zero input*/
00058     if ( saturatedSignal <= 0 ) return saturatedSignal;
00059 
00060     /*  scale the input value by 1/_scaling,
00061         equivalent to scaling with _scaling of all pixel values in curve
00062     */
00063     float satScale = saturatedSignal / _scaling;
00064 
00065     /*  if below first point in curve, do nothing*/
00066     if ( satScale < getPix( 0 ) )
00067       return saturatedSignal * getPmt( 0 ) / getPix( 0 );
00068 
00069     int nPairs = getNFloat()/2;
00070 
00071     /*  check for cut-off beyond last measured point
00072      */
00073     if ( satScale >= getPix( nPairs - 1 ) ) return getPmt( nPairs - 1 ) * _scaling;
00074 
00075     /* find index of the measured point closest but lower to the input*/
00076     int iUpper = 0;
00077     while ( satScale >= getPix( iUpper ) )  ++iUpper;
00078     int iLower = iUpper - 1;
00079 
00080     /*  return linear interpolation between points iLower and iLower+1*/
00081     float slope = ( getPmt( iUpper ) - getPmt( iLower ) )
00082       / ( getPix( iUpper ) - getPix( iLower ) );
00083 
00084     float extrapolation =
00085       getPmt( iLower ) + slope * ( satScale - getPix( iLower ) );
00086 
00087     return _scaling * extrapolation;
00088   }
00089 
00090 
00091 
00092   /************************************************
00093    deSaturatedError
00094   ************************************************/
00095   float SatCorrItepCutOff::deSaturatedError( const float saturatedSignal,
00096                                              const float saturatedSignalError ) const
00097   {
00098     /*  relative error same as input*/
00099     return saturatedSignalError / saturatedSignal
00100       * deSaturate( saturatedSignal );
00101   }
00102 
00103 
00104   /************************************************
00105    saturate
00106   ************************************************/
00107   float SatCorrItepCutOff::saturate( const float unSaturatedSignal ) const
00108   {
00109     /*  protect against negative/zero input*/
00110     if ( unSaturatedSignal <= 0 ) return unSaturatedSignal;
00111 
00112     /*  curve should be scaled - scale input instead*/
00113     float linScale = unSaturatedSignal / _scaling;
00114 
00115     /*  if below first point in curve, do nothing*/
00116     if ( linScale < getPmt( 0 ) )
00117       return unSaturatedSignal * getPix( 0 ) / getPmt( 0 );
00118 
00119     /*  check for cut-off beyond last measured point*/
00120     int nPairs = getNFloat()/2;
00121     if ( linScale >= getPmt( nPairs - 1 ) ) return getPix( nPairs - 1 ) * _scaling;
00122 
00123     /*  find index of the measured point closest but lower to the input*/
00124     int iUpper = 0;
00125     while ( linScale >= getPmt( iUpper ) )
00126       ++iUpper;
00127     int iLower = iUpper - 1;
00128 
00129     /*  extract linear interpolation between points iLower and iLower+1*/
00130     float slope = ( getPix( iUpper ) - getPix( iLower ) )
00131       / ( getPmt( iUpper ) - getPmt( iLower ) );
00132     float extrapolation = getPix( iLower )
00133       + slope * ( linScale - getPmt( iLower ) );
00134 
00135     /*  pixel axis is scaled by _scaling:*/
00136     return _scaling * extrapolation;
00137   }
00138 
00139 
00140   /************************************************
00141    saturatedError
00142   ************************************************/
00143   float SatCorrItepCutOff::saturatedError( const float unSaturatedSignal,
00144                                            const float unSaturatedSignalError ) const
00145   {
00146     /*  relative error same as input*/
00147     return unSaturatedSignalError / unSaturatedSignal
00148       * saturate( unSaturatedSignal );
00149   }
